meanings.definition: A small part or quantity intended to show what the whole is like.
meanings.sent1: I took a sample of the cake to taste it.
meanings.sent2: The teacher showed us a sample of the math problem before we solved it.
meanings.sent3: The sample of the song played on repeat in my head all day.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was just a sample of the joy she felt inside.
meanings.sent5: The sample of paint on the wall matched perfectly with the color we wanted.

meanings.definition: A specimen taken for analysis or testing.
meanings.sent1: The scientist collected a sample of water from the river for testing.
meanings.sent2: The doctor asked for a sample of blood to check for any infections.
meanings.sent3: The sample of soil in the jar looked like a tiny world of its own.
meanings.sent4: His collection of stamps was a sample of different cultures around the world.
meanings.sent5: The sample of fabric felt soft and smooth to the touch.

meanings.definition: To take a sample of something for analysis or testing.
meanings.sent1: She will sample the soup before adding more seasoning.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to sample the sauce to see if it needed more spice.
meanings.sent3: I will sample the new ice cream flavor before buying a whole cone.
meanings.sent4: He likes to sample different types of tea to find his favorite.
meanings.sent5: The musician will sample different beats to create a unique sound.
